Posted By: Folesauce (2/9/2011 3:48:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have become convinced that this is the most misread card in all of MTG. Its like people have combo's for the card before they even finish reading it. I've seen people try to imprint some crazy stuff.  
[Balance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balance), [burning wish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=burning wish), [pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pyroclasm), [demonic tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=demonic tutor), even saw someone try to imprint [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) once.  
And just from comments posted here...  
[dragon fodder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dragon fodder) = no  
[time walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=time walk) = no  
[wrench mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wrench mind), [duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=duress), [rampant growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rampant growth), [rite of flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rite of flame), [shahrazad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shahrazad) = no no no no no  
  
[day of the dragons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=day of the dragons) ??? = squirrelbeary has a sense of humor ;)
posts.html:
I have become convinced that this is the most misread card in all of MTG. Its like people have combo's for the card before they even finish reading it. I've seen people try to imprint some crazy stuff.
Balance, burning wish, pyroclasm, demonic tutor, even saw someone try to imprint Wrath of God once.
And just from comments posted here...
dragon fodder = no
time walk = no
wrench mind, duress, rampant growth, rite of flame, shahrazad = no no no no no

day of the dragons ??? = squirrelbeary has a sense of humor ;)

Posted By: Tunky (8/18/2010 6:01:38 AM)

posts.post_content:
@Cloworora: Dude, don't go there. You cannot and should *never* judge a card based on which cards are able to deal with it. By that very same logic, cards like [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel), [Jace the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Jace the Mind Sculptor), heck, even [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) and [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk) would be bad because you can answer them with [Doomblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomblade)/[Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boomerang)/[Force of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Will) herp 'a derp.   
No, what you should be judging a card on is much they help you win the game, and how much they demand answers. (And Isochron Scepter is a card that *demands* answers)
posts.html:
@Cloworora: Dude, don't go there. You cannot and should never judge a card based on which cards are able to deal with it. By that very same logic, cards like Baneslayer Angel, Jace the Mind Sculptor, heck, even Black Lotus and Time Walk would be bad because you can answer them with Doomblade/Boomerang/Force of Will herp 'a derp.
No, what you should be judging a card on is much they help you win the game, and how much they demand answers. (And Isochron Scepter is a card that demands answers)

posts.post_content:
Even things as simple as [To Arms](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=To Arms) are amazing.  
I have imprinted [inside out](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=inside out) in my tim deck for card advantage AND being able to deal with low power/high toughness creatures.   
If you use any can trip, and they cast a spell to kill this, you are still up the minor effect.
